dublin_core.dcvalue: Clinical photography has long been an important aspect in the management of dermatological pathology and has many applications in contemporary dermatology practice With the continuous evolution of digital and smartphone technology clinicians must maintain ethical and medico legal standards This article reviews how dermatology trainees are utilising this technology in their clinical practice and what procedures they follow when taking photos of patients We review the ethical and legal considerations of clinical photography in dermatology and present a hypothetical medico legal scenario
Clinical photography in dermatology: ethical and medico-legal considerations in the age of digital and smartphone technology.
